title: World War II Valor in the Pacific National Monument: Happenings at the Monument
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Photos & Multimedia     Video Archive     Happenings at the Monument                Happenings at the Monument                         Blessing the new USS Arizona Memorial dock Watch Loko’olu Quintero and Kiliona Palauni of the Hawaiian Church of Hawaii Nei give a Hawaiian blessing at the new USS Arizona Memorial dock before it was opened to the public on June 29, 2016.   Duration:2 minutes, 3 seconds                                US Army Divers Reenlist at the USS Arizona These US Army divers went underwater in May 2016 to reenlist at the USS Arizona.  Duration:1 minute, 35 seconds                                Marines from the 3rd Battalion, 3rd Marines Visit the Memorial These Marines have a special reason to feel connected to Pearl Harbor. 1LT Austin Singhoffer recently brought about 100 Marines from the 3rd Battalion, 3rd Marines, based in Kaneohe Bay, Hawaii, to the Pearl Harbor Visitor Center, and told us what the Marines thought of the USS Arizona Memorial.  Duration:1 minute, 27 seconds                                Pearl Harbor Survivor Lauren Bruner talks with Navy sailor They may have served 75 years apart, but they have more in common than you might think. Watch Pearl Harbor Survivor Lauren Bruner talk with CTI2 Thomas Cross about serving in the US Navy.  Duration:5 minutes, 51 seconds                                Green Bay Packers fullback John Kuhn talks about visiting the Memorial National Park Service Ranger Kyle Neiser got a chance to catch up with Green Bay Packers fullback John Kuhn during the Pro Bowlers' visit to WWII Valor in the Pacific National Monument in Honolulu, HI, on January 30, 2016.  Duration:1 minute, 23 seconds
